abimelech notice intention hasted thither force environed place faggot dry wood carrying thither person encouraging thereby army like rock incontinently compassed wood whereunto set fire round aboutv instant flamed burnt vehemently none saved perished wife child number fifteen hundred menthe shechemites flying burned upon rock besides many weaker sort calamity hapned shechemites worthy compassion intendeth enjoy rest time sleepeth guarded watch tyed unto fear awe one dare forsake sleepeth depart follow affair intend service thinketh necessary guard person therefore esteem king force greater rejoycing c v ad finem wishing happy reign queen vashti also made banquet unto woman royal palace whereas king desirous shew surpassed woman beauty ahasuerus sendeth vashti grace feast refuseth therefore cast sent unto commanding come banquet royal manner rest attendant curiously tied observation law persian forbiddeth woman seen stranger went unto king notwithstanding sent eunuch diver time unto yet persisted refusal come unto whereupon king moved displeasure gave banquet arising calld unto seven counsellers according custom persian belongd expound law accusd wife telling much slighted since sent diver time accompany banquet refusd obey therefore commanded declare opinion punishment appertaind one amongst calld muchaeus answerd injury offered unto persian likewise danger manner despised wife one would acknowledge duty towards husband taking example queen disobedience shewed towards governor whereupon concluded thus dishonoured severely punished done thought fit ordinance king might published thorow nation queen vashti separated bed another woman chosen place determination confirmed consent rest magi much afflicted king one side unwilling act contrary law countrey knew put away queen great passion reason beauty friend perceivd counseld forget memory love woman unprofitable send seek thorow country fairest woman amongst might choose take wife society another woman great affection bare unto vashti might extinguishd king approving counsel sent certain messenger deputy commanding bring unto fairest virgin found kingdom therefore assembled great number found babylon young orphan without either father mother brought uncle whose name mardocheus tribe benjamin one greatest men among jew beauty modesty virgin extraordinary raisd admiration beheld therefore babylon susa king command man approach throne except called chief city persia every day walked palacegate enquiring esther lovd dearly daughter king made law man approach presence upon pain death brother alexander alabarcha experienced philosophy addressed answer accusation urged jew caius commanded silence willed instantly withdraw displeased appeared manifestly intended cruel revenge quartered ptolemais beseeching constrain thing contrary law transgress ordinance forefather said wholly decreed bring erect statue temple first deprive u life afterwards shall seem good eye impossible u long soul remain within body permit forbidden law suffer impiety regard honour owe unto lawmaker predecessor ratified law intent encrease virtue petronius answered thus emperour emperour would ruled advice reason might prevail enforced obey otherwise life fortune stake hereunto jew answered lord said since resolved transgress mean command content caesar letter neither way violate infringe prescript law hope divine assistance imitation virtue ancestor fainthearted hope vain untimely desire life break law almighty god hath proposed unto u reward eternal felicity cause endure fortune whatsoever countrey law religion may remain inviolate ready encounter misfortune hope god assist u whose honour fear adventure danger rather obeying thee cowardice incurr perpetual ignominy god wrath speech cumanus saying soldier set cumanus understood like manner grievously offended regard injury yet exhorted saw forward keep peace fear lest sedition arise time feast seeing would way obey roman spare life worthy perish mine sword hand think good spare enemy think good likewise spare self truly meer folly self avoid fight confess commendable thing die liberty die fight hand took away liberty neither war u kill usit goodly matter die liberty yet die fighting judgd coward refuseth die need requireth also die need urgeth moreover withholdeth u offering self roman truly fear death shall therefore make certain self fear roman hand say spare u made captive pray consider liberty said pa courage kill one self maintain contrary part cowardthe similitude sailer think timerous seaman perceiving tempest comingit common course nature man kill yea heinous sin god sinketh ship wherein come moreover law nature sentiment creature kill self thereby also commit heinous crime god living creature seeking would willingly dye every one feeleth strong forceable law nature whereby desire live cause judge enemy seek take life u punish take indeed think great contempt man despise life god gift receive first let u expect ending body mortal framed corruptible matter soul immortalthe soul immortal portion god placed bodie sort partake nature god one abuse another putteth trust think perfidious wicked man shall think remove body god hath placed shall know abused hold slave worthy punished run away bad master shall held impious flee good master god ye know according law nature depart life render god received gave requires shall leave behind perpetual name posterity family unto soul obedient creator call give holy sacred mansion heaven whence revolution heaven remanded animate body pure themselvesgod revengeth author injury contrary cause death go dark hell god punisheth offence upon posteritythe custom antient jew dealt slew hence wise lawmaker forbiddeth knew god abhorreth crime amongst u kill decreed till sun go shall unburied though hold lawful bury killed war nation cause righthand cut killed judging soul thereby separated body hand deserves separated
